items.lesson_description: Learn how to use per-app languages to make your app more accessible and user-friendly. This feature lets you choose a different language for each app on your device, without the user changing their device language.
New in Android Studio 3.6, view binding gives you the ability to replace findViewById with generated binding objects to simplify code, remove bugs, and avoid all the boilerplate of findViewById.

Learn about the history of Android, from its beta release in 2007 to becoming the world's most popular mobile operating system. Discover the features that make Android unique and the benefits of using Android Studio to develop your apps with Kotlin.
